description: ELF (Executable and Linkable Format) file write events for Linux executables and shared libraries. Captures metadata and hashes for Linux binaries written to disk, critical for Linux malware detection and threat hunting.

columns.name: aid
columns.description: Agent ID - unique identifier for the endpoint

columns.name: cid
columns.description: Customer ID - unique identifier for the CrowdStrike tenant

columns.name: UserName
columns.description: Username associated with the file write

columns.name: TargetFileName
columns.description: Full path to the written ELF file

columns.name: FileName
columns.description: Base filename of the written ELF file

columns.name: ContextProcessId
columns.description: Falcon's unique process identifier for the writing process

columns.name: WritingProcessFileName
columns.description: Base filename of the process that wrote the file

columns.name: WritingProcessCommandLine
columns.description: Command line of the writing process

columns.name: MD5HashData
columns.description: MD5 hash of the written ELF file

columns.name: SHA256HashData
columns.description: SHA256 hash of the written ELF file

columns.name: SHA1HashData
columns.description: SHA1 hash of the written ELF file

common_operations: Join with ProcessRollup2 via ContextProcessId for writing process details
Match hashes against threat intelligence feeds
Detect files written to /tmp or hidden directories
Hunt for Linux malware and rootkits
